reviews.review_msg: Kevin is a really great prof! He's very understanding and super chill. Make sure to start studying early. His exams cover a lot of content but all the questions are fair. Very approachable in and out of class. His labs are clear and he helps you if you ask.
G.O.A.T, if you have him. You are in great hands.
1 word: daddy

Kevin is Awesome! Definitely consider taking him as a prof. His exams are fair for being a BPK course but start studying early. He's super accessible outside of class, will respond to your emails quickly and gives a lot of advice. He even opens up quizzes if you forget to do them and ask nicely. Start studying for the injury scenario early!
since this is a very hands on class I'd recommend going to lecture even though its not mandatory, lab part was fun and you can tell he just wants to help us learn

Professor Lunnie is an amazing professor for many reasons. He's fair, caring, SUPER accessible, easy to talk to and very eager to help with your learning. While his exams are challenging (lot of content and slightly difficult questions), they were fair questions to ask. Do NOT be afraid to ask him questions, he's a sweet guy!

Kevin was a phenomenal professor for this course. He would respond to emails within a matter of minutes. He was passionate about the course and was great in the labs, making them enjoyable. He started off the course by saying it is quite heavy in content but concepts were not too difficult to grasp. I would absolutely take this course with him!

Professor Lunnie does an amazing job at teaching a very content heavy course. Lectures are recorded and posted immediately! Lab is mandatory but fun, get ready to work out. Highly recommend this class, all the content is laid out for you, you just have to pay attention and memorize.

Goes through his slides really fast, and doesn't really explain concpets for new learners. Replies to emails fast. Very understanding. Lab is fun but the TA, Vini, marks SO hard and is not helpful when you approach him for clarification. Majority of the class got around 50% for the term paper, but the instructions were so unclear.
Kevin is truly one of the best profs I have had. He is an excellent explainer and makes his material interesting and engaging. I highly recommend him!

I'm really not the person to leave reviews, but Kevin is an amazing prof I hope everyone experiences at some point in their university career, so I had to. He is the most accommodating professor who genuinely cares about his students (and he replies to emails in minutes). The class information is useful and relevant. 100% recommend him and BPK 241.
He actually cares about his student and wants you to do well. Lectures are clear, lab is fun. However, be prepared to work hard as the content is quite heavy. Attendance mandatory for lab sessions.
Overall, a great guy. Passionate about kinesiology and explained topics well. Really cares about his students
The best prof I have ever had.

Kevin is by far the best profs at SFU. Super cool guy, makes lectures really engaging by incorporating his professional and coaching experiences.  Genuinely seems to want his students to learn and is super passionate about what he's teaching. Teaches info heavy courses so lectures are long, but he explains things well. Really approachable for help.

Great professor, 143 had 2 hour lectures and they were not always the most engaging, as everyone is a bit exhausted after a long lecture like that. But overall he is a great guy, super kind, and always willing to answer questions and get to know his students a little bit better. I recommend him!

Kevin Lunnie is a dedicated and caring prof who just wants his students to do well. He is very accessible outside of class, as I have received emails from him at 11pm "sent from iphone". His tests are very reasonable and truly show a student's learning, rather than setting them up for failure. His labs are interesting and you can tell he enjoys it.

Super refreshing to have a prof like him in uni. He truly is interested in the course & cares about students. If you ask him a question, he goes into deep detail to help you. His lecture notes are clear and the recorded lectures/lab videos saved me. Class is a lot of info so you need to study but he is the best prof you could take this class with.

Kevin is an awesome professor. I've had him for 110 and 241. Very easily found outside of class for help. The course content itself is not hard but the load is heavy but he addresses this first week and tells everyone to prepare for it. Fair marker and very clear on how to succeed in this course. Kevin is overall an amazing human being.

He gives straightforward lectures that are recorded so you can always review them later. Open to questions and is a great prof who knows his stuff. The course material was a lot of content memorization and he gives good tips on how to study for this course. Would recommend this prof to every student interested in BPK110.

Kevin was one of the best professors I have had so far at SFU. The class is overall fairly difficult and material piles on fast so make sure to stay on top soon as possible. Kevin replies to emails pretty fast and he actually cares and helps you understand.I ended up getting a B+ and the class average was a B-. Overall a great class to learn from

I had Kevin for both 241 and 143, and he's someone I will remember for the rest of my undergraduate career and onwards. Very caring, passionate, and responds to emails faster than any other instructor will ("Sent from iPhone.") 241 is a lot of work, but if you put in the effort and be proactive, Kevin will be there to guide you. 10/10 recommend.

He is probably my best prof I have had so far. He engages the students and participates with the students during labs. His lecture slides are a little fast if you are typing but my class was partially online so lectures were recorded. He is very easily accessible for office hours and knows his stuff so when you need help he will definitely help you

Kevin is one of the best profs I've ever had. 241 is a difficult class with lots to memorize but he helps you out every step of the way. Lectures are engaging, tests are difficult but fair and he is very accessible during office hours and by email. Extremely fair marker, always makes sure you get the highest possible grade, and wants you to succeed

Kevin is by far the best professor I have had at SFU. He is very caring and goes out of his way to assist students to the best of his ability. I would strongly encourage taking a course with Kevin if possible!

Absolutely amazing. He is always accessible by email and really accommodating for students. He arranged many zoom sessions to review before our midterm and final and was always there for his office hours to answer any questions we had. Best prof I had this semester no doubt.

He is a really good person and explains things clearly. He also loves to use different real-life examples to explain concepts. He also demonstrates a lot of examples of how to do the tape job for the lab as well as the injury scenario. He organizes a lot of zoom meeting for students to drop in and ask questions if they do have.

Content is not hard to understand, but you need to spend time on it especially as there are oral & practical presentations. I was barely making it, but I went to one office hour and my whole experience with BPK241 changed from that moment. He helped me with so much. Kevin is super passionate about his field and he really wants you to excel.

Kevin is an awesome prof. He is very accessible outside of class and care about the students a lot. If you watch the lectures and read the textbook each week youll do well. Make sure to go to his office hours to help clarify concepts and prepare before exams.

Kevin uses Diana Bedoya's textbook and the material is really interesting. Assignments are great to apply your knowledge and tutorials can help a lot with reviewing and learning the materials. So, the class is not extremely difficult with Kevin, but definitely not an easy class. Kevin is also approachable and helpful if you reach out to him.

Awesome guy, always quick to respond to emails clearly and concisely. His lectures arent boring but arent exciting at all, pretty standard. He definitely knows what hes talking about, given his experienced background. Hes also really nice and seems like a genuinely great guy who is passionate about BPK.

As a 5th year Kin student, I can say that Kevin is easily one of the best profs of the department. He is clear, concise, and incredibly caring of all his students, plus his email reply game is on-point! His exams are a little rough because of the imposed time constraints but nothing in the exams are out of left field.
Super nice prof, very understanding, accommodating, and very accessible. I personally found bpk110 to be on the harder side for a 100 level course but Kevin is a great prof.

Kevin is a good prof and posts videos on youtube so you don't need to come to lecture! BPK110 is not a GPA booster lol. Idk why people said it was, but it has a lot of information that you need to memorise. Not an easy class if you're not in science.

I usually would never take a science course but it was mandatory and I thought oh god here we go but with the way Prof Lunnie structured it, I didn't find it so boring and actually quite liked learning about my own nutrition. There was a small quiz every week but it forced me to actually learn something by watching the lectures and taking notes.
Great course, first ever A+ would recommend taking, however is anatomy heavy if you're not good at anatomy or haven't studied it a lot be wary.

Always watch the lectures because his quizzes have more of the content from it than the actual readings, so if you do only the readings you'll lose a few marks. Tutorials are mandatory, but really offer a lot of insight about what would be on the midterm etc. Kevin is super accessible outside of class, so make use of his office hours!

Kevin is a fantastic and passionate professor. He goes into much detail in lectures and labs to make sure all of the material is laid out well for everyone to understand, and makes it very straightforward as to what he expects everyone to know for exams. Hes also very generous to give out marks in lab and taping exams, even if mistakes are made.

Kevin is hands down one of the best profs at SFU. The course content is heavy but he tries his best to make it not too bad. The class itself is so fun! The lab is very hands on so its great for any kin student.

If you are able to take this class with Kevin, please do. I personally performed below expectations on the midterm, and Kevin was very accessible for extra help after lab and via email. It really helped me pull my grade back up in the rest of the course. A real stand up guy, and I recommend him to all students.

Kevin is by far my favourite professor at SFU. He genuinely cares about his students and their education. He replies almost instantly to emails with detailed answers to your questions. Exams are straight forward and tells you exactly what you'll be tested on. I wish I had him for all my BPK courses

replies to emails super quick, lectures are recorded, and always there when you need help. A LOT of memorizing, especially for the injury scenario. mt and finals are based on his lecture slides and textbook readings. make sure to study the materials after every class and lab to keep up and do well

Doesn't post complete lecture slides online, go to class. Lecture MT/Final multiple choice is tricky but long answer is easy if you do the textbook readings. Lab tape jobs you have to practice but grading is on the easy side. Injury scenario is difficult, prepare early! Really great prof overall, fun to talk to, teaches well, and very approachable.

Amazing guy, did his best to help us!  A lot of information to cram in and tricky questions for exams, but as everyone says, very applicable to anything bpk/sports. The taping was really fun and the anatomy is all memorization.

Kevin was awesome. The material itself is a lot of information, so you really need to studying early before an exam to memorize. He replies to emails extremely quick, which is very nice. He's caring and funny, but a bit monotone so it's a bit hard as it's an 8:30am class. He gave chocolate to everyone during the final!

Love the labs and how applicable the content of this course is. Multiple choice on exams are tricky but other than that this is a solid course for Kin majors or people interested in sports injuries and anatomy.

Kevin is an awesome prof, probably the best prof I've had at SFU for 3 years!!  He's helpful, understanding and friendly. Makes classes enjoyable, while also being very useful in the real world. He teaches the lab and lectures himself and is always there for extra help. Would take his classes again!!

Amazing prof. Although the course can be difficult as there is a lot of material covered, he made every lecture and lab enjoyable. Marks fairly and is very professional and organized. Would definitely take another class with him. If only he taught more :(

One of the most amazing profs ever. Never had someone reply to my email and promptly and with such detail as Kevin. He makes his notes, lecture and lab, clear. He tells you exactly what is expected of you and what to know to do well in the class. He is super approachable and friendly, and really cares about his students doing well. Amazing prof.
Kevin is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is so clear in explaining topics and how he will be marking. Also his lectures are very interesting and engaging.

Kevin is a phenomenal teacher and I found the class very interesting. He answers all questions thoroughly and I never left feeling confused after which is extremely important for someone who asks a lot of questions. He answers emails promptly and most important has a lot of personal exp. and is very interested in the material being presented.

BPK 241 is by far my favourite course taken so far in my university career. Not only is the material interesting, it has a lot of practical applications for those not even in the BPK program. I liked Kevin as a professor a lot; I even told him that he had an open invitation to all of my parties. He hasn't taken me up on it yet, but it'll happen.

Kevin is an amazing prof! It's a tough class, but Kevin is a fair marker and he lets you know what is expected of you. He explains things very well and approachable when you need extra help. Lectures are very useful and he gives good examples of real life applications.. Plus he is extremely attractive!!! Good class for athletes and trainers.

Kevin is AMAZING! He knows his stuff and has a clear answer for anything you ask. Super helpful and wants all his students to do well. He did a fantastic job teaching this course for the first time. I would love to take another course with Kevin.
Kevin is a huge beauty, good lecturers and labs. One of the better professors that I've had at SFU. Very fair grader.

Kevin is extremely knowledgable about the human body and is willing to help whenever you need it. He runs the labs and the lectures too, and covers a tonne of material. Exams are tricky and the multiple choice is quite picky, but it makes you study a lot. Arnheim's textbook is useful and needed for the 'essay' questions.

Kevin is really enthusiastic about what he teaches, makes lectures interesting. He is also a chiropractic doctor, which is awesome considering he teaches a sport injury course. Glad I took it with him. His notes are also super organized.
